meanings.definition: The principles, practices, or influence of the Christian church.
meanings.sent1: The ecclesiasticism of the church guides its teachings and rituals.
meanings.sent2: Many people find comfort in the ecclesiasticism of their faith.
meanings.sent3: The ecclesiasticism of the church can be seen in the beautiful stained glass windows.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the ecclesiasticism of Christianity was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The ecclesiasticism of the Christian church shapes the lives of its followers.

meanings.definition: The system of government or authority of the Christian church.
meanings.sent1: The ecclesiasticism of the church ensures order and structure.
meanings.sent2: The ecclesiasticism of the Christian church has evolved over centuries.
meanings.sent3: In the ecclesiasticism of the church, the bishop holds a position of power.
meanings.sent4: The ecclesiasticism of the Christian church is like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the ecclesiasticism of the church requires studying its history.
